description: iPhoto was a digital photograph manipulation software application developed by Apple Inc.
name: iPhoto

description: AppleWorks was an integrated office suite containing a word processor, database, and spreadsheet.
name: AppleWorks

description: Aperture was an image organizer developed by Apple for the macOS operating system. The software handled work such as importing and organizing image files, applying corrective adjustments and printing photographs.
name: Aperture

description: iWeb was a template-based WYSIWYG website creation tool that allowed users to create websites and blogs and customize them with their own text, photos, and movies.
name: iWeb

description: iDVD was a DVD authoring application for Mac OS that allows the user to burn QuickTime movies, MP3 music, and digital photos to a DVD.
name: iDVD

description: MobileMe was a subscription-based collection of online services and software offered by Apple Inc. All services were gradually transitioned to and eventually replaced by the free iCloud.
name: MobileMe

description: AirPort Express was a Wi-Fi base station with audio output capability.
name: AirPort Express

description: AirPort Extreme was a residential gateway combining the functions of a router, network switch, wireless access point and NAS as well as varied other functions.
name: AirPort Extreme

description: HomePod was a smart speaker with support for Siri and the Apple Music subscription service.
name: HomePod

description: AirPort Time Capsule was a wireless router featuring network-attached storage (NAS) and a residential gateway router.
name: AirPort Time Capsule

description: iPod Classic was a portable media player with a LCD display and hard drive for storage.
name: iPod Classic

description: iPod Nano was a portable media player introduced as a replacement for the iPod Mini.
name: iPod Nano

description: iPod Shuffle was a digital audio player. It was the smallest model in Apple's iPod family and the first iPod to use flash memory.
name: iPod Shuffle

description: iPod Socks were a set of multi-colored cotton knit socks for protection of iPods from damage during travel.
name: iPod Socks

description: PowerBook was a family of Macintosh laptop computers targeted at the professional market.
name: PowerBook

description: iBook was a line of laptop computers targeting entry-level, consumer and education markets, with lower specifications and prices than the PowerBook
name: iBook

description: iMac G3, originally released as the iMac, was a series of personal computers known for their egg shaped design and bright colored plastic.
name: iMac G3

description: iMac G4 (often called Lamp or Sunflower) was an all-in-one personal computer featuring an LCD mounted on an adjustable arm above a hemisphere containing the computer.
name: iMac G4

description: iMac G5 was an all-in-one personal computer featuring the classic square design and was the final iMac to use a PowerPC processor.
name: iMac G5

description: iPhone (1st generation) was the first smartphone designed and marketed by Apple, the release changed the way we use mobile phones.
name: iPhone (1st generation)

description: iPhone 3G was a smartphone designed and marketed by Apple. It was the second generation of iPhone, successor to the original iPhone.
name: iPhone 3G

description: iPhone 3GS was a smartphone where "S" stood for Speed and featured improvements such as better performance, a 3-megapixel camera with higher resolution and video ability.
name: iPhone 3GS

description: iPhone 4 was a smartphone in the iPhone family and it introduced a new hardware design for the first time.
name: iPhone 4

description: iPhone 4S was a smartphone where the "S" stood for Siri, an iPhone 4S-exclusive intelligent personal assistant that was later included in future generations of mobile Apple products.
name: iPhone 4S

description: iPhone 5 was a smartphone and was he first iPhone to be completely developed under the guidance of Tim Cook and the last iPhone to be overseen by Steve Jobs.
name: iPhone 5

description: iPhone 5S was a smartphone and featured a new white/gold color scheme in addition to white/silver and space gray/black.
name: iPhone 5S

description: iPhone 5C was a smartphone where the "C" stood for Color. It had a hard-coated polycarbonate shell instead of the aluminum of the original iPhone 5.
name: iPhone 5C

description: iPhone 6/6 Plus was smartphones and featured a larger 4.7/5.5 inch display, a faster processor, upgraded cameras, improved LTE and Wi-Fi connectivity and support for a near field communications-based mobile payments offering.
name: iPhone 6/6 Plus

description: iPhone 6S/6S Plus was smartphones featuring strengthened aluminium alloy chassis and a new 12-megapixel rear camera that can record up to 4K video at 30fps at first in the series, can take dynamic "Live Photos", the first increase in front camera photo resolution since the 2012.
name: iPhone 6S/6S Plus

description: iPhone 7/7 Plus was smartphones and introduced new color options (matte black and jet black), water and dust resistance, a new capacitive, static home button, revised antenna bands, and the controversial removal of the 3.5 mm headphone jack.
name: iPhone 7/7 Plus

description: iPhone 8/8 Plus was smartphones that were largely similar to that of their predecessors but introduced a glass back and addition of inductive charging.
name: iPhone 8/8 Plus

description: iPhone X was a smartphone that used a glass and stainless-steel form factor and "bezel-less" design, shrinking the bezels while not having a "chin". It was the first iPhone to use an OLED screen. The home button's fingerprint sensor was replaced with a new type of authentication called Face ID.
name: iPhone X

description: iPhone XR was a smartphone and considered an "affordable flagship" or "budget flagship" at its release, the XR shares key internal hardware but with features removed/downgraded to reduce the price.
name: iPhone XR

description: iPhone XS/XS Max was smartphones that introduced features such as dual-SIM support, filming with stereo audio, and strengthened water resistance.
name: iPhone XS/XS Max

description: iPhone SE (1st generation) was a smartphone that shares the same physical design and dimensions as iPhone 5S, and has upgraded internal hardware, including the newer Apple A9 system-on-chip, greater battery capacity, and a 12-megapixel rear camera that can record up to 4K video at 30 frames per second.
name: iPhone SE (1st generation)

description: iPhone SE (2nd generation) was a smartphone that followed the pattern made by the 1st generation sharing the dimensions and form factor of the iPhone 8, while sharing selected internal hardware components from the iPhone 11 lineup.
name: iPhone SE (2nd generation)

description: iPhone 11 Pro/Pro Max was smartphones featuring a triple-lens rear camera system and the A13 Bionic chip. The 11 Pro was Apple's first iPhone to feature a "pro" designation, which was previously used only for larger Apple devices, such as the iPad Pro and MacBook Pro.
name: iPhone 11 Pro/Pro Max

description: iPhone 12 Pro/Pro Max was smartphones with additions such as 5G support, the LiDAR sensor, ProRAW (DNG) allowing high quality lossless 12bit image capture. They were also the first iPhones to feature the MagSafe wireless charging and accessory system.
name: iPhone 12 Pro/Pro Max

description: Apple Watch was the first smartwatch in the Apple Watch family, it paired to the iPhone and was equipped with a built-in heart rate sensor.
name: Apple Watch

description: Apple Watch Series 1 was a smartwatch featuring improved battery life and a aluminium casing.
name: Apple Watch Series 1

description: Apple Watch Series 2 was a smartwatch that introduced water resistance to 50 meters, a display twice as bright as previous generations, and a GPS receiver. The Series 2 was sold in casings of anodized aluminium, stainless steel and ceramic.
name: Apple Watch Series 2

description: Apple Watch Series 4 was a smartwatch featuring the first predominant redesign of the Apple Watch, featuring larger displays with thinner bezels and rounded corners, and a slightly rounder, thinner chassis with a redesigned ceramic back.
name: Apple Watch Series 4

description: Apple Watch Series 5 was a smartwatch that introduced such as a compass and an always-on display with a low-power display driver capable of refresh rates as low as once per second. Additional new features include International Emergency Calling, enabling emergency calls in over 150 countries.
name: Apple Watch Series 5

description: Apple Watch Series 6 was a smartwatch with the new S6 processor that was up to 20% faster than the Series 4 and Series 5, a 2.5Ã— brighter always-on display, and an always-on altimeter.
name: Apple Watch Series 6

description: AirPower was a unreleased wireless charging mat, it was designed to charge up to three devices simultaneously. Scheduled to be released in early 2018, AirPower failed to materialize.
name: AirPower

description: iPod Touch (1st generation) was an iOS-based mobile device without cellular network capability. It could be used as a music player and a handheld gaming device, but it can also be used as a digital camera, a web browser and for messaging.
name: iPod Touch (1st generation)

description: Xserve was a line of rack unit computers that could be used for a variety of applications, including file server, web server or even high-performance computing applications using clustering.
name: Xserve

description: iPod Touch (7th generation) was an iOS-based mobile device without cellular network capability. It was the last iPod being sold before Apple discontinued the entire iPod product line in 2022.
name: iPod Touch (7th generation)
